subject: Design
title: The Scroll Wheel: A Tiny Revolution
description: A quick win: understand The Scroll Wheel: A Tiny Revolution.

hook.text: In 1995, Microsoft added a small wheel between two mouse buttons. It changed everything.

buildup.text: Before the scroll wheel, navigating a long page meant clicking tiny scroll bar arrows.

discovery.text: The wheel gave users a physical, tactile way to flow through digital content.

twist.text: The scroll wheel made long-form web pages viable. Without it, the web would be mostly short pages.

climax.text: A tiny hardware addition reshaped how billions of pages of content are designed and consumed.

punchline.text: Small interface changes can reshape entire mediums.

quiz.question: How did the scroll wheel change web design?
options: It made long-form content practical to navigate
It eliminated the need for links
